text: Oswald (died c. 776) was a medieval Bishop of Selsey, often called Osa for short. ==Life== In 765 Oswald witnessed a charter of Osmund, King of Sussex.Anglo-Saxons.net Charters S48 accessed 25 August 2007 In 772 Oswald received a grant from Osfrith, King of Mercia.Anglo-Saxons.net Charters S108 accessed 25 August 2007 Kelly suggested that "It is possible that Osa was a kinsman of King Osmund, and of the contemporary Oslac and Oswald, who also seem to have been regarded as kings before 772".Kelly Charters of Selsey p. lxxxiv Oswald was consecrated between 747 and 765, and died between 772 and 780.Fryde, et al. Handbook of British Chronology p. 221 ==Citations== ==References== * * ==External links== * Category:Bishops of Selsey Category:8th-century bishops
title: Oswald of Selsey
